titles.title: Firearms Fairness and Security Act
A bill to amend title 18, United States Code, to prohibit the sale of a firearm to a person who has been convicted of a felony in a foreign court, and for other purposes.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.summary: 4/28/2005--Introduced. Firearms Fairness and Security Act - Amends the Federal criminal code to prohibit the sale or other disposition of a firearm or ammunition to, or the possession or shipment of a firearm or ammunition by, a person who has been indicted or convicted in any court outside the United States of a crime punishable by imprisonment exceeding one year (except for an antitrust law violation) if such crime would be punishable by imprisonment exceeding one year in the United States.
